definition: clock/o'clock/time as measured in hours and minutes/bell/CL:架[jia4],座[zuo4]
handleless cup/goblet/to concentrate/variant of 鐘|钟[zhong1]

point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items

sentences.english: It’s no longer required of you to work for the rest of your life to get paid by the hour, on the hour.
sentences.chinese: 你不会再被要求在你的余生打钟点工。

sentences.english: Wang run early in the city, she did four households part-time one day.
sentences.chinese: 王小早奔波在城市里，她一天做四户人家的钟点工。

sentences.english: I thought of Lylian, the hour maid hired by my parents.
sentences.chinese: 我还想到了莉莲，我父母雇的钟点工。

sentences.english: I also thought about Lillian, our parents' part-time maid.
sentences.chinese: 我还想到了莉莲，我父母雇的钟点工。

sentences.english: To treat an illness to the father, she makes the hour labor to make money.
sentences.chinese: 为了给父亲治病，她做钟点工赚钱。

sentences.english: Online hourly professionals are becoming a newly emerging job, the Daily Business reported.
sentences.chinese: 《每日商报》报道，网络钟点工正成为一种新兴职业。

sentences.english: Demand has the market, and I at a loose end, then the plan does hour work.
sentences.chinese: 有需求就有市场，而我正闲着，于是打算做钟点工。

sentences.english: Ask the hour maid servant to ASH the dirt off the floor.
sentences.chinese: 叫那个女钟点工把地板上的污垢擦掉。

sentences.english: But if we had a maid to clean the windows, it would be much better.
sentences.chinese: 但是如果有个钟点工来擦玻璃就好多了。

definition: woman hired to take care of a newborn child and its mother in the month after childbirth
plumbing and electrical work/tradesman who does both plumbing and electrical work
